column2: .NET (WPF and Windows Forms) bindings for the Chromium Embedded Framework

column5: message
build.ps1 - escape commas for PowerShell (#2902)

WinForms Example - Add ChromiumContainerControl to host docked DevTools

Required for arrow/tab key presses to be forwarded correctly to DevTools
Only required when CefSettings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false

WPF - Add new DirectWritableBitmapRenderHandler implementation

Use as default when MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false

WPF - Add lock to AbstractRenderHandler Dispose

Was trying to avoid adding a lock, unfortunately it's still possible for the CopyMemory function to be called
after the MemoryMappedFile has been Disposed.

WPF - Add Resize Hack Test Code

- Add test code from https://github.com/mol/CefSharp/blob/reworkedhack2779/CefSharp.Wpf.Example/MainWindow.xaml.cs#L181

WPF - Additional RenderHandler Dispose Improvements

- Hide Browser when Disposing, reduce changes of RenderHandler being called
- Add additional IsDisposed check
- Set RenderHandler to null before Disposing

WPF - Improve ChromiumWebBrowser Dispose

- RenderHandler wasn't being disposed at all
- Used newer syntax for null Dispose calls

WPF - Interop/WritableBitmapRenderHandler  memory allocation improvement

If the MemoryMappedFile is smaller than we need then create a larger one

WPF - Replace RtlCopyMemory p/invoke with NativeMethodWrapper.MemoryCopy

- RtlCopyMemory only works on x64, we could use the slower RtlMoveMemory, going with a native wrapper around RtlCopyMemory
- Renamed CopyMemoryUsingHandle to MemoryCopy (cannot be CopyMemory or RtlCopyMemory as macro with that name already exists)

https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp/pull/2885#issuecomment-529033351

Issue #2885

Add a ".NETCoreApp3.0" dependency to the .nuspec files. (#2894)

This ensures the transitive dependencies (CefSharp.Common) are correctly resolved in .NET Core 3.0 projects.

Contributes to #2796
WPF Example - Disable Stylus and Touch Support

WPF - Modify CopyMemory EntryPoint to work with .Net Core (#2885)

* Fix the entrypoint declaration for CopyMemory.

Contributes to #2796

* Follow-Up: Switch to RtlCopyMemory which is faster, but requires that the buffers do not overlap.

CefSettings - Add custom dictionary to allow setting of command line args with no value

- Updated CefExample to remove "1" values from the command line arg examples

Issue #2858

Update support.yml

Add comments about issues closed in error, users must complete the bug report and post a comment.

MethodRunnerQueue/ConcurrentMethodRunnerQueue - Remove custom task execution queue

- ConcurrentMethodRunnerQueue we now directly queue tasks on TaskScheduler.Default
- MethodRunnerQueue now uses LimitedConcurrencyLevelTaskScheduler (example from Microsoft) to limit execution to one concurrent task
- MethodRunnerQueue tasks are now run on the ThreadPool directly instead of our own custom thread, should have some threading implications
for user
- IMethodRunnerQueue now implements IDisposable

Resolves #2873
WebBrowserExtensions - Make GetScript public and rename to GetScriptForJavascriptMethodWithArgs

IRequest/IResponse - Improve IsReadOnly handling

- Throw exception if attempting to set property on readonly request/response
- return ReadOnlyNameValueCollection if Headers are readonly
WPF - Add IWpfWebBrowser.Paint/VirtualKeyboardRequested events to interface

IBrowserHost - Add GetZoomLevel

Can be called directly on the CEF UI thread

WPF - Add NotifyDpiChange method

Extract DPI change code into a public method that can be called when the `WPF` window changes it's DPI
As we target .Net 4.5.2 we don't have access to the new managed DPI change notification that was added in WPF (.Net 4.6)

Resolves #2856

ClientAdapter::GetResourceRequestHandler - LoadHtml and (Un)RegisterResource would only work if RequestHandler not null

- Revised login so RequestHandler not required

Update README.md

Release 75.1.141

WPF - Remove call to host.Invalidate

Was accidentally committed

WinForms Example - Minor changes to DevTools docked example

- Add/revise comments
- Rename some variables

Follow up to #2804

WinForms - Add example of how to dock devtools into the same window. (#2804)

* Add a SplitContainer as the base UI panel and place the browserPanel in Panel1 and new devToolsPanel in Panel2.
Create two new public methods to open and close the devtools.

* BrowserForm - Changed the Show/Close devtools to call the new methods in the BrowserTabUserControl. If the LifeHandler is null, normal behaviour is assumed.

* Handle the DoClose event in LifeSpanHandler if the IBrowserHost.CloseDevTools() is called directly. This is more of a fail-safe, if the normal CEF behaviour is allowed then entire application will close.

* Added some addtional comments.

* Uncomment the instantiation of the LifeSpanHandler

* Removed devToolsPanel from designer
Removed CloseDevToolsDocked() method
Made ShowDevToolsDocked() method easier to copy and paste
Closing Devtools should now be handled in LifeSpanHandler.DoClose()
Added a bool to the LifeSpanHandler constructor whether to handle Browser popups.
Added Toolscript menu item to show DevTools Docked or Popup
Added async Method to check it DevTools is open

* Changed field access modifier to private

* Renamed dispose devtools handler with a more meaningful name

Updated to reflect upstream changes see https://magpcss.org/ceforum/apidocs3/projects/(default)/CefCookieManager.html

Resolves #2855

WPF Example - MenuHandler commands now fire reliably

- The MVVM Light RelayCommand keeps a WeakRef to the command action, for us this is anonymous, so we
need to keep the target alive.
- Updated MVVMLightLibs (required for keepTargetAlive)

WPF Example - Improve demo of hosting popup in ChromiumWebBrowser instance

- LifespanHandler renamed to ExperimentalLifespanHandler to make it clear the feature is experimental
- Add additional check for devtools popup

ClientAdapter - Call IWebBrowserInternal Set/On methods when ChromiumWebBrowser is used for hosting popup

IWebBrowserInternal calls like SetLoadingStateChange weren't being made when IsPopup is true, add additional
HasParent check to determine if we're hosting the popup in a ChromiumWebBrowser instance.

LegacyJavascriptBinding - Enabled field was overwritten when a popup was opened

Popups don't transmit their own bound object information, _legacyBindingEnabled was being set to false
Fixed typo in readme.md (#2857)

ClientAdapter::MethodInvocationComplete - Add checking for valid frame

Make we have a frame that matches the Id and that it's valid before attempting to create a IPC message
Wpf - Fix Typo built instead of build
WPF - Remove disable-gpu-compositing

build.ps1 - Force TLS 1.2 for GitLink download

Running locally the following error was occurring
`Exception calling "DownloadFile" with "2" argument(s): "The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure
channel.`

Update to CEF 76.1.5+gd8a577c+chromium-76.0.3809.87

ISelectClientCertificateCallback - Update xml doc, return null means no certificate selected.

Update WinForms Example to deal with user cancellation of certificate selection UI

Resolves #2853

Scheme Registration - Only register custom scheme name one

Adding multiple entries to CefSettings.RegisterScheme that share the same scheme name
yet have different domain/schemehandlerfactory implementations is valid.

We will only register the first set of SchemeName/SchemeOption values (first call to RegisterScheme).

WcfEnabledSubProcess - OnBrowserDestroyed add null checks and log msg if WCF was null

It's likely the WCF host didn't start and some break points should be added in ManagedCefBrowserAdapter::InitializeBrowserProcessServiceHost
to catch the actual exception. We're not logging as it causes too many false positives as it's expected there will be errors
when browser is created then rapidly Disposed.

Resolves #2839
Upgrade version to 75.1.140
Upgrade to CEF 75.1.14+gc81164e+chromium-75.0.3770.100

WPF - OnWindowStateChanged only call WasHidden(false) when previous state was Minimized

Store the previous window state and only call IBrowserHost.WasHidden(false) if the browser was
previous hidden. Call isn't required when transitioning between Normal and Maximized

Rect - Change to use Math.Ceiling as that appears to match what CEF uses

cefclient uses Math.Floor though when I examine the values returned they're always one less
use use Math.Ceiling appears to match

WPF - GetScreenInfo scale Rect/AvailableRect

Scale by DpiScaleFactor
Rect - Add DebuggerDisplay

WPF - store width/height in local variable upon size change

Do this so it's easier to implement a workaround for #2779

WinForms - Only use DefaultFocusHandler when !MultiThreadedMessageLoop

If the WinForms UI thread and CEF UI thread are one in the same then we're not using MultiThreadedMessageLoop
Upgrade to CEF 75.1.7+gb34af23+chromium-75.0.3770.100
update CefGlue source code link; (#2850)

Use Canvas.Top="0" for PART_image absolute position. (#2844)

Using Canvas.Bottom will cause glitchiness when resizing the browser.
On a height change, the height of the canvas changes first, and since
a new frame has not yet been rendered, PART_image still has the old
height, causing the image to jump around

V8Serialization - Don't throw exceptions

Instead of throwing an exception which will in most cases crash the MethodRunnerQueue
we'll populate the returned data with an error message for an unknown type
For an unknown enum convert to string

Javascript Binding - Add support for JsonString

JsonString is parsed into CefValue using the CefParseJson function
If your data is already stored in JSON then it can be parsed directly
or you can use a serializer of your choosing to turn a object into JSON

Add Shift+Tab as inputs to browser when MultiThreadedMessage loop is disabled. (#2814)

When MultiThreaded message loop is disabled, we use the winform message loop. We want to ensure that Shift+Tab (cycle selection back) is recognized as a valid input in this case or it breaks keyboard accessibility.

JavascriptCallback - Hack to work around upstream issue

JavascriptCallback's are limited to only working in the main frame
Frame ids aren't the same between processes, so makes it almost impossible to handle callbacks in sub frames

https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/issues/2687/cefframe-getidentifier-differs-between
https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp/issues/2743#issuecomment-502566136

This should be reverted after the problem has been resolved.
JavascriptCallbackProxy - Remove comment that's no longer relevant

JavascriptObjectRepository - Only return Root objects (toplevel/parent objects)

GetObjects was returning all objects, even those that are sub objects

Javascript Legacy Binding - Pass objects on CefBrowserHost::CreateBrowser

Previously objects were sent in OnRenderViewReady, which is only called once for a browser instance, not for process switches
Now objects are passed when the browser is created, still need to check for popup handling

Initial version 75 upgrade and NetworkService changes

Compiles, that's about it at this point, there are major CEF breaking changes, and lots to be addressed.

Browser Process (main process)
- Removed IResourceHandlerFactory as it no longer fits with the structure that CEF provides
- New IResourceRequestHandler interface added, not plumbed in yet
- CefSettings - Add RootCachePath and ApplicationClientIdForFileScanning

BrowserSubprocess (render process)
- SendProcessMessage was moved from CefBrowser to CefFrame
- OnBrowserCreated added extraInfo param

The BrowserSubprocess changes for this upgrade should be complete

Async JavascriptBinding - Add support for returning Task (#2771)

* Async JavascriptBinding - Add support for returning Task

Remove Parallel Task execution code from MethodRunnerQueue
Add ParallelMethodRunnerQueue
  - For the new code path the Func is executed, if the Result is a generic Task we wait for it's completion
  - If the task is not generic then we return immediately

This is only enabled when CefSharpSettings.ConcurrentTaskExecution = true;
* MethodRunnerQueue - Display error message when method returns Task
* ParallelMethodRunnerQueue - Rename to ConcurrentMethodRunnerQueue
* MethodRunnerQueue - Improve formatting of error message when method returns Task

DefaultFocusHandler.OnGotFocus - Add browser null check

For the print dialog we appear to be passed a CefRefPtr<CefBrowser> reference which doesn't appear to trigger an OnAfterCreated call
so we have no reference to it. Looking at the `CefBrowser`, there's no real data of value, empty url, no frame information (just an invalid frame id)
so for now we'll just ignore it in DefaultFocusHandler, we don't want to handle for popups anyway

RequestContext.cpp - LoadExtension resolve issues with CefPostTask

For the x86 version we define and undefine CEF_INCLUDE_BASE_INTERNAL_CEF_BIND_INTERNAL_WIN_H_
as the /clr compliation option attempts to be helpful and convers all the __fastcall versions
to __stdcall which already exist, so we just use the standard calling convention and ignore
the optimised ones. The original error is
warning C4561: '__fastcall' incompatible with the '/clr' option: converting to '__stdcall'
(compiling source file RequestContext.cpp)

Working towards #2139

* CefSharpApp.h - Allow CefCustomScheme->SchemeHandlerFactory to be null

If cefCustomScheme->SchemeHandlerFactory is null then we no longer attempt to call CefRegisterSchemeHandlerFactory
You can then choose which RequestContext you wish to register your handler for, no longer forcing you to register
in the global context

Remove null checks in OnScheduleMessagePumpWork as we're throwing an exception if they're null when the CefApp is created

Cef.h - Remove ThrowIfCefNotInitialized

As IsInitialized is set when CefInitialize returns and it appears to be possible the OnContextInitialized is called
before it returns then this exception wasn't going to work.

Testing with Cef.GetGlobalRequestContext and Cef.GetGlobalCookieManager and they both return null if called before Cef.Initialize
So it shouldn't be possible to actually access the cookie manager/RequestContext. Improved the xml doc

OffScreen - Simplify BitmapBuffer.ResizeBuffer

Was using Array.Resize to modify the existing array, unfortunately this doesn't yield the performance result the name implies.
A new array is created and copies elements from the old array, so performance is actually worse than allocating a new array.
For now we'll just create a new empty array.

Rewrite WPF/OffScreen OnPaint

OffScreen
  - Now maintains a raw Byte[] buffer that is used to create the GDI bitmaps
can be overridden and raw buffer access granted (eliminates the forced memory copy to the memory mapped view)

WPF
  - MemoryMappedFile.CreateNew is now used to create the in memory view and copy the buffer
  - InteropBitmapFactory only create new MemoryMappedFile selectively. If the MemoryMappedFile is larger than we require then just reuse it rather than
    releasing then allocating a smaller section of memory that's used for double buffering with InteropBitmap and WritableBitmap
  - Removed CefDirtyRect and used existing Rect class
  - Rename rendering event to Paint, still preferable to implement IBitmapFactory or subclass ChromiumWebBrowser
  - Update ChromiumWebBrowserWithScreenshotSupport to support new rendering method - not very well tested.

Add Cef.ShutdownWithoutChecks method - basically allows you to call the underlying CefShutdown method with minimal checks (just IsInitialized and a simple lock)
Add ExperimentalStreamResponseFilter - buffers all data before performing text processing

OffScreen - code cleanup and expose more of the underlying methods, allow for overriding of IRenderWebBrowser method when inheriting from ChromiumWebBrowser
Mark ScreenshotOrNull as obsolete - use OnPaint instead
Mark NewScreenshot event as obsolete - use ScreenshotAsync instead

WinForms - If the ChromiumWebBrowser has it's handle recreated then in OnHandleCreated we will now attempt to reparent a existing instance rather than creating a new browser

# Conflicts:
#	CefSharp.WinForms/ChromiumWebBrowser.cs

WPF Example - update MenuHandler to implement custom menu, execute command based on CefMenuCommand enum rather than trying to use IRunContextMenuCallback which isn't working (upstream issue)
This is a workaround for #1767
You can use the default CEF menu it does however require you to integrate CEF into your main message loop see #1795

WPF - Layout rounding has been changed to UseLayoutRounding so values for ActualWidth and ActualHeight are scaled by the framework
This reverts the change from #1962 where we manually rounded up - it's still possible to do this by inheriting from ChromiumWebBrowser and overriding GetViewRect should you choose to

Easy way to test the rounding changes is to add Margin="0.5,0.5,0,0" to a ChromiumWebBrowser instance in xaml
You can manually disable layout rounding of course UseLayoutRounding="False" in xaml on the control

WPF Example - Add ChromiumWebBrowserWithScreenshotSupport example - adapted from https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp/pull/462/
When screenshot is requested then rendering to the screen is temp disabled, browser is resized and frames are used to take the screenshot

Add Debugger Display attribute to cookie - excluded the cookie value as they can be rather large, show basically the rest of the cookie in the debugger
Add example of VisitAllCookiesAsync

JSB - Add support for async methods to return classes

Structs and classes can now be returned from an async method
Properties and fields are supported now. The returned class/struct is readonly effectively, no updates will be sent to the bound object.

Just to clarify this is only for objects bound using RegisterAsyncJsObject

Rewrite the tests using the QUnit framework, makes for much nicer presentation and should be easier to maintain them, also verifies tests completed successfully.

JSB Add support for dynamic keyword (using ExpandoObject)

As ExpandoObject implements IDictionary we can use it interchangeable with only minor breaking changes.
Those expecting Dictionary<string, object> should change to IDictionary<string, object> or ExpandoObject for their param types
This will also impact anyone who has implemented their own custom IBinder
I'd suggest changing the type checking from explicitly checking Dictionary<string, object> to use Type.IsAssignableFrom or another method of comparison
DefaultBinder binder has been updated to accommodate ExpandoObject (now being returned by ObjectsSerialization.cpp)

Update to Cef Version 59.0.0

Note that there is one breaking change as offscreen windows are now automatically transparent due to this cef change: https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/commits/3f71138d64586d774f645a6db5283b5205ea9df4

To make a offscreen window non-transparent you need to set the background colour as shown below were it is set to white:

browserSettings.BackgroundColor = 0255255255;

Fix LifeSpanHandler not Called During Dispose (#1764)

- Make it so that the lifespan handler is still called when the
  ChromiumWebBrowser is disposed We need to make sure that the
  LifeSpanHandler is still around when `managedCefBrowserAdapter`
  is disposed since it is going to call `CloseBrowser`. That way,
  we can implement LifeSpanHandler and reject closing the entire
  application as described in #1574

Use RenderOptions of the control in Wpf ChromiumWebBrowser.cs CreateImage

This little change allows users to set the RenderOptions BitmapScalingMode for the ChromiumWebBrowser Wpf control just like this:

<cefSharp:ChromiumWebBrowser RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode="Fant">

While NearestNeighbor (fixed value before my edit) looks fine if each rendered pixel is exactly displayed as a single pixel, using that setting for a browser placed in a viewport leads to ugly results.

You can test the different BitmapScalingMode settings for example in the Wpf.Example application if you set the RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode property for the ChromiumWebBrowser in BrowserTabView.xaml.
Just change the Angel (Tweak WPF Rendering) of the browser in the running application to actually see the differences.

Best Regards
Johannes Viehmann

Ignore callback usage after dispose rather than crashing with NullReferenceException

Users have no way to determine whether a callback has been disposed.
Resulting in the following crash if the callback is fired.  This change
silently ignores the methods.  Another approach would have been to add
an IsDisposed flag that users must check but this seems error-prone.

Exception: System.NullReferenceException
Message: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.'
Source: CefSharp.Core
Stacktrace:
at CefSharp.CefCallbackWrapper.Continue()
at ...

Fixed process not exiting in Windows XP

Fixed process not exiting in Windows XP

Added a handler assignment on the first call to CefSharp::Initialize
which will ensure CEF is shutdown properly should the calling program
not manually call the shutdown method before the process exits.

This bug only seems to affect Windows XP, however I have tested on both
Windows XP and Windows 7 and with this change neither have any ghost
processes left over after the program calling CefSharp exits.

NEW: Added overload of method LoadHtml with additional parameter 'url' to Winforms and Wpf control.
This is necessary, because the current implementation of LoadHtml doesn't give access to the paremter as exposed by _clientAdapter->GetCefBrowser()->GetMainFrame()->LoadString.
Instead, the parameter is hardcoded to "about:blank". This has 2 disadvanteges with no workaround:
1. html code with relative paths to resources are not possible.
2. html code with (even absolute )paths to local files(images) are not possible, due to different security zone.

add a browser-local version of RegisterJSObject

expose BrowserCore objects from IWebBrowser

The immediate purpose here is to make it easier to add local JS object
binding. Rather than have each WebView implement the interface on its own,
we can simply have the BrowserCore implement it, and expose that. That
also allows us to keep parts of the interface "internal", which wouldn't
be possible if it was all exposed through IWebBrowser. If we like this
change, we might get rid of some of the IWebBrowser methods that are just
wrappers, and instead rely on shared code in BrowserCore.
